de.esoco.storage

Interface Query<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, de.esoco.lib.manage.Closeable, org.obrel.core.Relatable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JdbcQuery

    public interface Query<T>
extends de.esoco.lib.manage.Closeable, org.obrel.core.Relatable
    A query object that represents a query of storage objects. Closing a query will also close any currently active QueryResult of that query. Therefore it is not necessary to close the result separately. Only if a result is no longer needed but the query is kept for later re-execution the result should be closed explicitly.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        QueryResult<T> execute()
                throws StorageException
        Executes this query and returns a QueryResult for the objects that match the query criteria. A query may be executed multiple times.
        Returns:
        An iterator that will return the objects matching the query
        Throws:
        StorageException - If executing the query fails

      • getDistinct

        java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> getDistinct(org.obrel.core.Relatable rAttribute)
                                     throws StorageException
        Returns a set containing the distinct values of a certain object attribute.
        Parameters:
        rAttribute - The attribute to get the distinct values of
        Returns:
        A set containing the distinct attribute values
        Throws:
        StorageException - If querying the values fails

      • getStorage

        Storage getStorage()
        Returns the storage this query has been created for.
        Returns:
        The storage

      • positionOf

        int positionOf(java.lang.Object rId)
        throws StorageException
        Determines the zero-based position of an object with a certain ID in the result of this query. If the ID doesn't exist in this query -1 will be returned.

        This is an optional operation which may not be supported by some implementations or underlying storages in which case -1 will be returned.

        Parameters:
        rId - The ID of the object to determine the position of
        Returns:
        The zero-based index of the given ID in the query or -1 if the ID could not be found in the query result or if this operation is not supported by the implementation
        Throws:
        StorageException - If querying the position fails

      • size

        int size()
  throws StorageException
        Returns the size of this query, i.e. the number of objects that an execution will yield. Depending on the underlying implementation the result may not be exact and therefore differ from the actual number of objects returned by iterating through a query result (e.g. if changes are made to a database concurrently). Therefore application should use the returned value only as an estimation and base all final calculations on the iteration.

        This is an optional operation which may not be supported by some implementations or underlying storages in which case -1 will be returned.

        Returns:
        The estimated query size or -1 if it cannot be determined
        Throws:
        StorageException - If the size calculation fails
